meanings.definition: Reinforced with tension before being subjected to stress.
meanings.sent1: The prestressed bridge held up under pressure.
meanings.sent2: The prestressed concrete wall remained strong despite the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The prestressed beams were so tough, they laughed in the face of heavy loads.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a prestressed cable, ready to withstand any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the prestressed steel cables running through the structure stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: Subjected to a stress greater than that which will be applied in service.
meanings.sent1: The prestressed metal showed signs of strain before even being used.
meanings.sent2: The prestressed rope snapped under the weight of the load during testing.
meanings.sent3: The prestressed material seemed to be saying, 'I can't take it anymore!'
meanings.sent4: His heart felt prestressed, as if it had already endured more than it could bear.
meanings.sent5: The prestressed support column groaned under the excessive weight, but held firm.
